intro: Phaseolus vulgaris var. cyanodes, commonly known as the blue bean, is a variety of common bean characterized by its striking blue flowers. This plant belongs to the Fabaceae family and is native to the Americas, particularly Central and South America. It is an annual herbaceous plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and pods containing edible seeds. The blue hue of its flowers is due to the presence of anthocyanin pigments, which also contribute to its ornamental value.
